title.rendered: Visa introduces NFT program to help creators build their business

content.rendered:
The New York Stock Exchange-listed multinational financial services provider, Visahas recently launched a program to help creators expand their small businesses through non-fungible tokens (NFT for its acronym in English), according to information from ‘Finance Magnates’.

The initiative aims to help artists, musicians, fashion designers and filmmakers of the digital age. Based on the details provided, a group of emerging entrepreneurs will be selected for each cycle of the program. Visa will provide support to entrepreneurs to help them enhance your knowledge and presence in the NFT ecosystem.

Cuy Sheffield, Head of Crypto at Visa said that NFTs have the potential to become a powerful accelerator of the creator economy, adding: “We have been studying the NFT ecosystem and its potential impacts on the future of commerce, retail and social media Through the Visa Creators Program, we want to help these new small and micro businesses to take advantage of new media for digital commerce”.

2021 continued to be a year of change for the NFT market, as interest in the emerging technology increased significantly. Volumes related to NFTs hit record highs last year.
